column1: #Text=There are obvious limitations to a pure self regulatory approach , but our hope is that self regulation will provide a sufficient good outcome in this case .
#Text=What do you see as an ideal solution to resolve the misleading situation with DoNotTrack that you acknowledged in your response to the second question ?
#Text=: First of all , I personally do not think the name of DoNotTrack is misleading .
#Text=However , the challenge is to have a meaningful standard that users can still be aware of the risks of that may be involved without giving a false sense of security .

#Text=For example " private mode " in your browser does not prevent that your internet access provider can still keep track of what websites you visit , websites can collect information about you and so on .

column1: #Text=It only removes the trace of the sites you visited in your " browser " .
#Text=Similarly , the websites can by accident or intention to be set up in a way so they do not comply with the DNT signal .
#Text=There is always a risk of rouge agents .
#Text=How do you envision the " self regulatory " approach ?

column1: #Text=: Self regulation basically means that the different stakeholders without having a legal obligation to do so , comply with a set of rules , for example an industry technical specification as W3C tracking protection standards .
#Text=My take is that DNT would be a success if all major stakeholders involved in the process would comply with the standards .
#Text=It is more an open question to what extent compliance to the technical standard is sufficient to comply with applicable laws in its respective country , for instance , in EU , or in the USA .
#Text=contacted the Mozilla press office and got replies on behalf of the Mozilla Corporation .
#Text=When and why did you decide to start supporting the Do Not Track feature ?
#Text=Do Not Track in the desktop Firefox browser in January 2011 , and in June 2011 Firefox for Android became the first mobile browser to support Do Not Track .
#Text=: We support Do Not Track because we believe it is crucial to put users in control of their online experience .
#Text=Do Not Track is intended to give users choice and control in a persistent , accessible way without preventing the customization and valuable advertising that powers the Web economy .
#Text=We are seeking ways to give users better insight and control into the ways their personal information is collected , used , stored and shared .
#Text=Do you think that all websites should respect DNT users ' preferences in the long run ?
#Text=: Mozilla is actively working with companies that have started to implement Do Not Track and with others who have committed to doing so .
#Text=Ultimately , the goal is for all industry stakeholders to trust and respect the signal in the long run .
